abstracts.cdata!:
The Fourth Fisheries Project is a
            fisheries development and conservation project. It involves
            infrastructure construction for fishpasses, canal
            re-excavation, prawn pond water supply and drainage, and
            prawn and shrimp hatcheries. This report describes the
            policy, legal, and administrative framework that the project
            will be nested into. Some of the mitigation measures
            include: 1) The potential of beel and baor draining will be
            reduced through bed elevations in the canal and the adjacent
            river. 2) The possible threat to rice cultivation due to
            entry of water through a fishpass will be reduced through
            study of river hydrology and adjustment of pool, baffle, and
            slot dimensions to minimize discharge volume through
            fishpass. 3) The potential for eutrophication of natural
            water courses from pen and cage culture and from prawn farms
            due to overfeeding and metabolic waste excretion will be
            reduced by specifying the use of pelleted feeds rather than
            loose feeds. 4) A comprehensive groundwater survey will be
            conducted in areas where tubewells are used for prawn farm
            water sourcing to determine the size of the aquifer and the
            recharge rate to reduce the danger of groundwater
            extraction. 5) The problem of overharvesting snail
            population for prawn feed will be regulated through
            licensing of collectors and allocation of specific areas to
            individual collectors. The culture of snails in snail
            nurseries will be promoted and illegal imports of snails
            will be controlled.
